task_summary: The robot is instructed to pick up the red object from the table, moving from perceiving its location to grasping and lifting it.

task_long_description.overview: This episode features a table-top scene with three colored objects (red, blue rectangular, blue irregular) and a robotic manipulator. The robot must locate, approach, and grasp the red object, then safely lift and retreat, as required by the instruction. Accurate perception and precise positioning are essential, while avoiding collisions with other objects. The gripper is opened before grasp, and closed with sufficient but not excessive force.
preconditions: Red object is present on the table and not obscured
Robot is operational and positioned with line-of-sight to the workspace
stepwise_plan: Visually locate the red object on the table
Confirm detection; retry scan if needed
Move arm above red object with safe offset
Approach and align with red object
Close gripper with sufficient force to grasp
Lift and retreat from the table surface
success_criteria: Red object successfully detected and grasped
Object is held securely by the gripper
Robot retreats without dropping or colliding with other objects
failure_and_recovery: Object not visible: retry scan up to 3 times
Grasp is unstable: reopen gripper and retry approach
task_long_description.termination: Red object is grasped and clear of table surface (after retreat).

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Check if the red object is visible
Perform grid scan to find the red object
Open the gripper to pre-grasp width
Move the gripper above the red object
Approach and align with the red object
Close gripper to grasp the red object
Verify the red object is in the gripper
Retreat with the grasped red object

failure_modes: Grasp fails (object slips or not held)
recovery_strategy: Retry scan up to 3 times if not detected
If grasp fails, repeat approach and grasp sequence
assumptions: Frames show task up to grasp and retreat; no placement phase present.
Red cylindrical object in all frames is assumed to be 'red_object'.
No pick-and-place beyond table is visible, though instruction says 'pick up'.
No evidence of place action or designated drop-off area in visual frames; tree terminates at retreat step.
Blue objects are static and not picked.
Instruction 'pick up' mapped to 'grasp+retreat', as placing is not observed.

expected_success_criteria: Red object is securely held by gripper after retreat
No collision or drop with other objects
